foodbank_information.name: Buckfastleigh Foodbank
foodbank_information.main_location:
St Luke’s Church
Plymouth Road
Buckfastleigh
TQ11 0DA

Help is normally available on Friday mornings, but please ring beforehand on 01364 644485 or email info@buckfastleigh.foodbank.org.uk, leaving a contact phone number. A member of the team will call you back between 10.00am and midday to arrange a time for collection.
Our café is open from 10.00am to midday where you can have a free drink and a cake. A volunteer will be there for a chat if you want and may be able to suggest places to go for further help. We also have a laptop computer with internet access available for you to use. Afterwards, please come to the hall door at the back of the church to collect your food parcel.
For out-of-hours help please ring 01364 644485 or 01364 643120 and leave a message.

foodbank_information.name: Cheddar Valley Foodbank
foodbank_information.main_location:
Unit 8
Wessex Business Centre
CHEDDAR
BS27 3EJ

To enquire about how to obtain a food parcel, or to make a food donation, please contact the foodbank by phone on 07922 309369, or by email at info@cheddarvalley.foodbank.org.uk.

Once a fortnight the foodbank is visited by a member of the Citizen’s Advice Bureau, who has been trained to provide specialist advice to those individuals experiencing financial difficulty. They can help with budgeting, debt management, benefit claims and many other financial problems. Thanks to a collaboration between the Citizen’s Advice Bureau and Trussell Trust, this confidential service is completely free for anyone living in the Cheddar Valley area. You can also contact the local Citizen’s Advice Bureau directly, or you can contact the foodbank and we will put you in touch.

foodbank_information.name: Croydon Foodbank
foodbank_information.main_location:
Croydon Foodbank left the Trussell Trust network on 7th October.

As Croydon Foodbank are an individual charity in their own right, this doesn’t mean the food bank has to close, but as we’re no longer involved with the charity we don’t know what their plans for the future are. As always, our focus remains on the well-being of people who need support, and we are working with nearby food banks in the area to ensure there is continued support for local people who don’t have enough money for the essentials.

Norwood and Brixton Foodbank will continue supporting many areas of the borough with emergency food. For support or referrals please email contact Norwood & Brixton Foodbank: https://www.trusselltrust.org/get-help/find-a-foodbank/norwoodbrixton/

The Trussell Trust runs a network of more than 1,300 food bank centres across the UK – in the last year our network provided more than 2.1 million three-day emergency food parcels to people facing hardship. Food banks within the network are independent charities within their own right and have their own boards of trustees and governance structures. We work alongside food banks in our network to undertake quality assurance visits, ensure projects are run to a high standard and provide training and guidance with issues projects face. This includes one-to-one support on the ground through an Area Manager; access to a unique data collection system for tracking donations; stock and food distribution; websites and marketing materials; a share in nationally negotiated fundraising partnerships with corporates; and a network of peers to share best practice and resources with.

For more information, please contact us on enquiries@trusselltrust.org

foodbank_centre.local_transport_links:
Coming by bus

The church is served by a number of buses, which stop adjacent to and opposite Riversdale Road which is 2 minutes from the church.

Coming by car

There is a car park, with limited spaces, outside the Church Hall. It is accessed from Summer Road and the turn is opposite Riversdale Road (KT7 0QQ).

There is also a public car park (66 spaces) in Ashley Road (KT7 0NH) which is a 2 minute walk to the church via Church Lane.

For more information see https://www.stnicholaschurch.org.uk/visiting

foodbank_information.name: Gleadless Valley Foodbank
foodbank_information.main_location:
Over the last few months, we have been working closely with the trustees of Gleadless Valley Foodbank to try and identify a route forward for the food bank within the Trussell Trust network. Following these discussions, the Board of the food bank have decided to leave the Trussell Trust and transition to an independent food bank model.

Gleadless Valley Foodbank has been part of our network since 2012 and over many years the food bank has ensured local residents in need of help have been able to access emergency food and wider support. We would like to place on record our heartfelt thanks and gratitude to all who have served as trustees over the years, staff and volunteers, and to everyone who has supported the food bank with food or financial donations.

As always, our focus remains on the well-being of people who need support. In order to minimise disruption as this transition takes place, a food bank centre at Terry Wright Community Hall on Gleadless Road has been established and will operate for the foreseeable future on Fridays from 1:30pm – 3:30pm. This food bank will be operated by S6 Foodbank, part of the Trussell Trust network.

geolocation.address: Gleadless Valley Methodist Church, Blackstock Road, Sheffield, S14 1FT

Food parcels can be collected from the foodbank centre addresses below.

Please note you must be referred by an agency with foodbank voucher in order to receive a food parcel. Contact us to find out what agencies we work with.

If travelling by car:
From Upper Brook Street (A34) turn onto Booth Street East. After the turning for the aquatics centre car park there is another side road on your left (there is a sign that says ‘Prospects’ beside it) Turn onto this road and there is a barrier with an intercom, press the button on the intercom and say you’re ‘coming to St. Peter’s House’ . Then follow the road around to the right and park up outside the large black door (please don’t block this). You can then walk round the building to the entrance. If you are struggling please phone 07928412339
M13 9GH

centre_geolocation.address: Middleton Gardens, Middleton, Manchester M24 1AB, UK

foodbank_centre.local_transport_links:
Buses:
Any bus that takes you to Middleton town centre – the shopping centre is adjacent to the central bus station.

Directions:
The foodbank is on the second floor of Middleton Shopping Centre in the Lighthouse Project which can be found at the top of the escalators between YMCA and Iceland.

Parking:
The shopping centre has a car park and parking charges apply, and we are on the same level as the roof top car park which is where you will first arrive when entering the centre’s parking facilities. Disabled parking is available on this level too.

There are other car parks nearby within walking distance and some have free parking for up to 3 hours and others require you to display a ticket. Please read the details for each car park carefully.

foodbank_information.name: Swale Foodbank
foodbank_information.main_location:
Swale Foodbank is a registered charity number 1190373. We normally run a multi-centre foodbank so we are based at 4 different locations throughout the week.

All of our centres run to a voucher model – foodbank vouchers are required in advance of receiving a food parcel.

You can get more information by calling us on 07486 370709 or emailing us on info@swale.foodbank.org.uk and one of our wonderful volunteers will get in touch.

Both Shrub Hill and Foregate Street Railways Stations are within a 10 minute walk.

Crowngate Bus Station is a 10 minute walk away.
